Event.description: Ever wonder what goes into making a Penny Arcade comic? Join Gabe and Tycho in the Main Theatre and take part in creating Monday’s comic! -- Panelists: Gabe & Tycho!
Event.name: Penny Arcade - Make a Strip!

Event.description: How does a game go from concept to market and what role does a publisher play in the process? Some of the top Australian publishers/developers including Halfbrick, Defiant Development, Klicktock and Right Pedal Studios discuss what they look for in a game and how they help get it to market. -- Panelists: Tony Reed [CEO, GDAA], John Passfield [Program Manager, Right Pedal Studios], Morgan Jaffit [Founder, Defiant Development], Phil Larsen [CMO, Halfbrick Studios], Matt Hall [Founder, Klicktock]
Event.name: Indie Publishing Down Under

Event.description: Development of new titles for retro computer and console systems is growing in popularity along with the growth in retro gaming itself. -- Panelists: So rather than being an area of the hobbyist and freeware, the market for professional quality software and hardware has reached a stage where small teams or individuals can work in this developing area.
Event.name: The Rise of Homebrew

Event.description: Should you let your ten-year-old play Grand Theft Auto? What’s the best way to introduce your child to RPGs? Should you be working so hard to teach your five-year-old to play more strategically in Settlers of Catan? What do you say if your son prefers J.K. Rowling to J.R.R. Tolkien, or if your daughter prefers Episode I to Episode IV? These questions and many more will be discussed by writers for GeekDad.com, some leading Australian geek mums and the PAX audience. Come share your stories and advice on how to ensure our kids grow up to be geeks like us! Don’t have kids? Show up and find out what may be in store for you if you ever do! -- Panelists: Daniel Donahoo [Core Contributor, Wired’s GeekDad.com], Rae Johnston [Gaming Editor, TechLife], Giselle Rosman [Convenor, International Game Developers Association, Melbourne], Luke Bennett [Contributor, Wired’s GeekDad.com, Creative Manager for CV Newton Publishing]
Event.name: Geek Parenting: Raising Generation v2.0

Event.description: Omega Force’s Akihiro Suzuki joins us on stage to discuss the state of the Japanese games development industry, what it’s like creating a game that appeals to both western and eastern audiences, and the challenges studios face in keeping a franchise fresh. -- Panelists: Atsushi Miyauchi [Director, Dynasty Warriors 8], Daniel Chlebowczyk [Product Manager, Madman Entertainment], Paul Houlihan [Host, The Fourth Player]
Event.name: Crafting a game series for the otaku crowd - a Dynasty of gaming Warriors

Event.description: Melbourne based Writer/Director Michael Shanks (Timtimfed) and his team talk about how and why they spend their lives creating pointless yet occasionally amusing content for YouTube. -- Panelists: Michael Shanks [Writer/Director, LateNite Films], Chris Hocking [Director, LateNite Films], Nick Issell [Writer/Actor, Colossonaut Productions], Sam McCabe [Freelance Cinematographer]
Event.name: Killer Cats, Talking Boobs and Skyrim: An Exploration of creating Video Content from Timtimfed

Event.description: Want to hear our musical guests do something BESIDES play music? Perhaps you wish to ask them questions? We’ll you’re in luck! We happen to have a panel for that. -- Panelists: Jeff Kalles [Penny Arcade], The PAX Australia musical guests!
Event.name: Musical Guest Panel

Event.description: Gearbox Software is at the first PAX in Australia! Join us for a rare behind the scenes look at Borderlands 2 and get the latest news and updates from Gearbox. Line up early - Borderlands fans won’t want to miss this one! -- Panelists: Randy Pitchford [Chief Executive Officer/President, Gearbox Software], Brian Martel [EVP/Chief Creative Officer, Gearbox Software], Paul Hellquist [Creative Director on Borderlands 2, Gearbox Software], Anthony Burch [Writer on Borderlands 2, Gearbox Software], Chris Faylor [Interactive Marketing Manager, Gearbox Software]
Event.name: Inside Borderlands

Event.description: A fun, audience-focused session where Aussie eSports personalities, organisers, and media combine forces to put together the dream eSports federation. Think butcher’s paper, colourful markers and a ton of free-flowing ideas. This panel will include experts in the space. Their extensive knowledge of Australian and international competitive gaming, eSports history and current issues make this relevant and timely. Audience participation will be vital and play a key role guiding conversation during the discussion. -- Panelists: Zorine Te [eSports and Community Manager,Gamespot], PJ Russel [eSports and Community Manager ANZ, Blizzard Entertainment Australia], Lloyd Smith [General Manager, Team Immunity], Nick Vanzetti [Managing Director, Australian Cyber League]
Event.name: The Australian eSports Federation: Let’s Make It Happen

Event.description: Child’s Play seeks to improve the lives of children in hospitals around the world through the power of play. Join Jamie and Kristin of Child’s Play to talk about how video games benefit hospitalised children and how the video game community can help. -- Panelists: Jamie Dillion [Child’s Play], Kristin Lindsay [Child’s Play]
Event.name: Child’s Play Panel!

Event.description: For the first time, the Xbox One will be shown in Australia. Join Microsoft as they share their vision and show more about how the Xbox One will shape the future of gaming.
Event.name: Microsoft Presents: Xbox One

Event.description: Experience and lessons learned from succeeding in the “Old Boys Clubs” of the VFX and Games Industries as a young woman. From leading a team of men ten years older than her on Animal Logic’s Happy Feet to getting into Game Developer Magazine’s “Power 50” of influential people to watch in the games industry. This session presents tips, tricks and hilariously scandalous stories for any woman who wants to do more in their career but isn’t sure how to advance in a male dominated field. -- Panelists: Epona Schweer [Producer, Indie Bits]
Event.name: Not Fair? Then Grow Some Ovaries and DO Something About it!
Omegathon Round 3 - Portal

Event.description: Does the games industry garner too much scrutiny from outside sources and within? With review score aberrations often called into question, writers are constantly criticised and developers and publishers professionally and personally attacked. Has it all gone too far? Can we all just get along and we work together to bring a new constructive gaming age into fruition? -- Panelists: Dave Kozicki [Founder, rawDLC], Josh Philpott [Founder, rawDLC], Stephen Farrelly [Editor, AusGamers], Joab Gilroy [Editor, GameArena], Rae Johnston [Gaming Editor, TechLife] Daniel Wilks [Editor, Hyper magazine]
Event.name: Why So Serious? Has the Industry Forgotten That Games Are Supposed to Be Fun?

Event.description: Here is your chance to find out more about Animal Crossing: New Leaf, meet some fellow Animal Crossing fans and hear from the development team in a special Animal Crossing: New Leaf video presentation that will be shown during PAX Australia. Remember to bring your Nintendo 3DS and Animal Crossing: New Leaf town to PAX!
Event.name: Nintendo Presents Animal Crossing: New Leaf

Event.description: Video games offer a myriad of new and exciting ways to put your music in front of a huge, enthusiastic audience. With the rise of independent games, there are an immense number of opportunities to work in the industry as an audio professional. This lecture will be covering the technical aspects of game scoring as well as walking you through a step-by-step tour of the game audio creation process. In addition to this, it will also cover broader topics such as sound design, audio implementation, and working as part of a game development team. -- Panelists: Akash Thakkar [Composer/Sound Designer, Independent]
Event.name: What’s That Sound? Creating Great Game Audio

Event.description: Gamers are an entitled bunch. Over the past five years alone we’ve had petitions launched to change the ending of an epic space adventure, frenzied debate over cover art for a thought provoking, 1920’s shooter and most recently, had petitions launched to President Obama to stop sales of a certain title because consumers believe “it violates our rights to have a choice between the originals or the reboot.” Are gamers crazy? Or are they simply passionate beyond belief? -- Panelists: Our panel is going to take a look at five occasions of extreme “gamer entitlement” and talk about the issue at its core. Did consumers have a right to request BioWare rewrite the entire ending of Mass Effect 3, or was that an impeachment on their artistic vision as creators?
Event.name: Gamer Rage - Entitlement Issues

Event.description: If you’re a fan of ABC TV’s Good Game here’s your chance to ask presenters Bajo, Hex and Goose and the show’s creator Janet Carr just about anything about the shows and how they make them. The panel will be moderated by Dave Callan. -- Panelists: Is there any downside to being paid money to review games?
Event.name: Good Game - Ask Us (almost) Anything

Event.description: We’ve all seen the rise of the indie video game, but there’s another surge happening in the games community you might not be aware of; the indie board game. From self-publishing mavens to print-on-demand hobbyists, indie board games are starting to make their way onto mainstream tabletops everywhere. Join a panel of Australian board game designers and publishers, and find out what it takes to go from prototyping your initial idea (CHECKERS! with ROBOTS! and HIT POINTS!), all the way to the final boxed product. -- Panelists: Anthony Sweet [Owner, Handwritten Games], Sean Carroll [Managing Director, 93 Made Games], Wesley Lamont [IManaging Director, RAEZ], Paul Nicholas [Blue Room Games], Alex Dijk [Blue Room Games]
Event.name: Indie Board Games: Making Your Own Tabletop Game

Event.description: Nerd, geek, troll, basement dweller, spree killer: mainstream media’s treatment of gamers is rarely accurate or flattering, but it does matter to the greater community. What CAN be done, what SHOULD be done and WHO should be doing it? -- Panelists: Nic Healey [Senior Editor, CBS Interactive], Dan Chiappini [Editor, Gamespot], Anthony Burch [Writer for Borderlands 2, Gearbox Software], Patrick Weekes [Senior Writer, BioWare], Karin Weekes [Lead Editor, BioWare], Rae Johnston [Gaming Editor, TechLife]
Event.name: That’s What She Said: Why Mainstream Media Portrayals of Gamers Matter

Event.description: Our second night of concerts held after the 4th round of the Omegathon features Brisbane group 7bitHero, the international gaming music coverband The Minibosses, and the rock opera performance of the Protomen.
Event.name: Omegathon Round 4 - Defense Grid & Saturday Night Concerts

Event.description: Meet the team at Australia’s Largest Game Development Studio, as they discuss how they bring titles like the Real Racing franchise, the Sims FreePlay, Need for Speed Most Wanted and Mass Effect Infiltrator to life. -- Panelists: Kynan Woodman [Producer], Thomas Baker [Designer], Ptolemy Oberin [Software Engineer], Nina Nikolic [Community], Amanda Schofield [Software Engineer], Nathan Barnes [Sr. Artist Lead], Tony Lay [GM]
Event.name: Firemonkeys - A Day In The Life

Event.description: The award-winning GameArena Podcast is recording a live show from PAX, judging the year so far in 2013. Luke, Junglist, Heath, Jae and Joaby will discuss the year so far, the best (and worst) of E3 and the must see events at PAX. Join them to see if they can keep the language to a reasonable minimum and if they can actually finish remotely on time. -- Panelists: Joab Gilroy [Editor, GameArena], Luke Lawrie [Reporter, GamePlanet AU], Jeremy Ray [Host, GameArena], Jae Leong [Reporter, GamePlanet AU], Heath Dickson [Podcaster, GameArena]
Event.name: The GameArena Podcast - Live From PAX Australia

Event.description: These people work for the industry you love so much: making the games, publishing them, reviewing them. But how much do they truly know? Could they tell you all about MOBAs, mocap and Moogles? Will they embarrass themselves in spectacular public style? Join our panellists on a wild adventure filled with groans of realisation and enough gaming knowledge to keep your next dinner party on the edge of their seats! -- Panelists: Donald Duong [Quiz Master, New Game Plus], Jason O’Callaghan [Possible panellist, New Game Plus], Jamie Galea [Assistant Quiz Master, New Game Plus], Alanah ‘Charalanahzard’ Pearce [Videogame Journalist, Xbox Australia], Paul Houlihan [Host, The Fourth Player], James Dominguez [Journalist, The Age], Matt Kelly [Game Designer, Two Bulls], James Kozanecki [Marketing Co-ordinator, Mindscape]
Event.name: The Ultimate Industry Quiz Showdown!

Event.description: Fallout: Lanius is the blood soaked origin story of Legate Lanius, the primary antagonist from 2010’s Fallout: New Vegas. -- Panelists: The story: ‘On the brink of ruin, the Hidebark people are about to be wiped out by the slaving organisation, Caesar’s Legion. However, their most ruthless warrior would prefer death to dishonour. “Fallout: Lanius” will recount how a single man brings ruin to his people due to his lust for bloodshed and victory.’
Event.name: Fallout: Lanius - A Blood Soaked Fallout Fan Film

Event.description: Reformat the Planet is a documentary film that premiered in 2008 at the South by Southwest Film Festival about the chiptune music scene. The film stars various artists and highlights certain events in the culture such as Blip Festival.
Event.name: Screening - Reformat the Planet

Event.description: With the arrival of The Settlers of Catan in the United States in the mid-ninties, more and more people have been discovering the new breed of board game that had been quietly evolving in Germany for the past 30+ years. Going Cardboard takes you into the world of “designer” board gaming,m from the community of enthusiastic fans, to the publishers and self0punlishers, and of course, the designers.
Event.name: Screening - Going Cardboard A Board Game Documentary
